intro: Androstylanthus paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Androstylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in yellow or orange hues. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a velvety texture. Androstylanthus paraensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
